content: how can I get a dump of what rustc_metadata produces?

In addition to [graphviz output](#formatting-graphviz-output-dot-files), MIR debugging
flags include an option to generate a MIR representation called `Spanview` that
uses HTML to highlight code regions in the original source code and display
compiler metadata associated with each region.
but I guess maybe metadata is used in a generic way and is not the information I want
and another related question, is there a Rust metadata visualizer? like if I have an rmeta file can I visualize it in some way?
want to debug an issue and this information would be helpful

Santiago Pastorino said:

and another related question, is there a Rust metadata visualizer? like if I have an rmeta file can I visualize it in some way?

That would be a cool feature!
but I have no idea, I was naively asking because maybe this already exists
I wrote this a while ago, but it hasn't been updated for almost a year: https://github.com/bjorn3/rust_read_rlib
You can use rustc -Z ls, but it doesn't show very much
